required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Efficacy Study of CD22 CAR-T Cells for Relapsed or Refractory Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia
clinical_study.official_title: Safety and Efficacy Study of CD22 CAR-T Cells for Relapsed or Refractory Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia

brief_summary.textblock: This is an open, single-arm, clinical study to evaluate efficacy and safety of anti CD22 CAR-T cell in the treatment of recurrent or refractory B-ALL

detailed_description.textblock:
The CARs consist of an anti-CD22 single-chain variable fragment（scFv）, a portion of the human CD137（4-1BB） molecule, and the intracellular component of the human CD3ζ molecule. Prior to CAR-T cell infusion, the patients will be subjected to preconditioning treatment. After CAR-T cell infusion, the patients will be evaluated for adverse reactions and efficacy.
The Main research objectives:
To evaluate the safety and efficacy of CD22CAR-T in patients with recurrent or refractory B-ALL
The Secondary research objectives:
To investigate the cytokinetic characteristics of CD22CAR-T in patients with recurrent or refractory B-ALL

primary_outcome.measure: Safety: Incidence and severity of adverse events
primary_outcome.time_frame: First month post CAR-T cells infusion
primary_outcome.description: To evaluate the possible adverse events occurred within first one month after CD22 CAR-T infusion, including the incidence and severity of symptoms such as cytokine release syndrome and neurotoxicity
Remission Rate including complete remission(CR)、CR with incomplete blood count recovery(CRi)、No remission(NR)

secondary_outcome.description: the copy number of CD19 CAR- T cells in the genomes of PBMC by qPCR method and percentage of CD19 CAR- T cells measured by flow cytometry method

secondary_outcome.time_frame: First month post CAR-T cells infusion
secondary_outcome.description: Cytokine( IL-6,IL-10,IFN-γ,TNF-α ) concentration (pg/mL) by flow cytometry method

arm_group.description: Patients will be treated with CD22 CAR-T cells

intervention.description: Biological: CD22 CAR-T; Drug: Cyclophosphamide,Fludarabine; Procedure: Leukapheresis
